page.title: 14LANDSCAPE/BUILDINGS:WOODTON
page.content: The landscape is open & pleasing with wide views of gently undulating arable land,rising from below 100' to 150' A.S.L.,not broken by many hedges but by groups of trees such as oaks,ash & maple.There is woodland north of Woodton Church & a substantial tract at nearby Hedenham.Several moats are to be found eg.around Woodton Old Hall The flatness of the countryside made Seething ideal for the wartime air- field built in 1942-3,but a band of gravel has been eroded by the stream running along Woodton Street to form a relatively steep-sided small valley. Woodton village lies over .5 mile from its C13 church with its round tower. There are several interesting old houses in the area;5 are listed grade II & 1, Oak Farm is grade II**; there are 6 grade III,the latter under revi- sion & may be upgraded to protect them
